nub.timing

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • nub.timing.Task
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TimingTask

    public class Task
extends java.lang.Object
    Tasks are (non)recurrent, (non)concurrent (see isRecurrent() and isConcurrent() resp.) callbacks defined by overridden execute().

    Note that concurrence of the task execution (which requires a separate execution thread) should be implemented by derived classes, i.e., this class just implements the task sequential api.

    A task runs (see run(long)) at a certain period() which define the interval duration between two consecutive executions (see also frequency()). Do not use the task for drawing since it will not necessarily run every frame.

    Call TimingHandler.unregisterTask(Task) to cancel the task.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Task.Callback 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Task()
      Constructs a sequential recurrent task with a period() of 40ms (i.e., a frequency() of 25 Hz).
      Task(Task.Callback callback)
      Constructs a sequential recurrent task that will execute callback (see setCallback(Callback)) with a period() of 40ms (i.e., a frequency() of 25 Hz).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Task

        public Task(Task.Callback callback)
        Constructs a sequential recurrent task that will execute callback (see setCallback(Callback)) with a period() of 40ms (i.e., a frequency() of 25 Hz).

      • Task

        public Task()
        Constructs a sequential recurrent task with a period() of 40ms (i.e., a frequency() of 25 Hz). The task execute() is set as its callback() method.

    • Method Detail

      • setCallback

        public void setCallback(Task.Callback callback)
        Sets the callback method which should be provided by third parties using this task.

        The callback will be executed (see run(long)) at a certain period(). Do not implement drawing in your callback since it will not necessarily be executed every frame.

        See Also:
        callback()

      • callback

        public Task.Callback callback()
        Returns the task callback method.
        See Also:
        setCallback(Callback)

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Callback method which should be implemented by derived classes.

        The task will be executed (see run(long)) at a certain period(). Do not implement this method for drawing since it will not necessarily be executed every frame.

      • run

        public void run(long period)
        Sets the task period() in milliseconds and call run(). If task isRecurrent() the execute() method will be invoked recurrently every period() milliseconds; otherwise it will be invoked once after a period() delay milliseconds.
        See Also:
        run(), isRecurrent(), enableRecurrence(boolean), period(), setPeriod(long)

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the task according to period(). The timer may be scheduled for repeated fixed-rate execution according to isRecurrent().

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Deactivates the task. See isActive().

      • toggle

        public void toggle()
        Calls stop() if the task isActive(), and run() otherwise.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Tells whether or not the timer is active.

      • period

        public long period()
        Returns the task period (the task execution interval duration) in milliseconds. Non-recurrent tasks execute only once taking this value as their execution delay. Default value is 40 ms.
        See Also:
        setPeriod(long), frequency()

      • increasePeriod

        public void increasePeriod(long delta)
        Same as setPeriod(period() + delta).
        See Also:
        setPeriod(long), setFrequency(float)

      • setPeriod

        public void setPeriod(long period)
        Defines the task period() in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        period(), setFrequency(float)

      • setFrequency

        public void setFrequency(float frequency)
        Defines the task frequency() in Hz.
        See Also:
        frequency(), setPeriod(long)

      • frequency

        public float frequency()
        Returns the task execution frequency in milliseconds. Default value is 25 Hz.
        See Also:
        setFrequency(float), period()

      • enableRecurrence

        public void enableRecurrence()
        Same as enableRecurrence(true).
        See Also:
        disableRecurrence(), enableRecurrence(boolean), isRecurrent(), enableConcurrence(boolean)

      • disableRecurrence

        public void disableRecurrence()
        Same as enableRecurrence(false).
        See Also:
        enableRecurrence(), enableRecurrence(boolean), isRecurrent(), enableConcurrence(boolean)

      • enableRecurrence

        public void enableRecurrence(boolean enable)
        Enables or (disables) the task recurrence according to enable. Non-recurrent tasks execute only once using period() as their execution delay.
        See Also:
        isRecurrent(), enableRecurrence(), disableRecurrence(), enableConcurrence(boolean)

      • isRecurrent

        public boolean isRecurrent()
        Returns whether or not the task is scheduled to be executed recurrently.

        A recurrent task is periodically executed at fixed duration time intervals (see period() and setPeriod(long)). A non-recurrent task will only be executed once just after a delay of period() ms.

        Tasks are recurrent by default, see Task().

        See Also:
        enableRecurrence(boolean), isConcurrent()

      • enableConcurrence

        public void enableConcurrence()
        Same as enableConcurrence(true).
        See Also:
        disableConcurrence(), enableConcurrence(boolean), isConcurrent(), enableRecurrence(boolean)

      • disableConcurrence

        public void disableConcurrence()
        Same as enableConcurrence(false).
        See Also:
        enableConcurrence(), enableConcurrence(boolean), isConcurrent(), enableRecurrence(boolean)

      • enableConcurrence

        public void enableConcurrence(boolean enable)
        Enables or (disables) the task concurrence according to enable. Task concurrence should be implemented by derived classes.
        See Also:
        isConcurrent(), enableConcurrence(), disableConcurrence(), enableRecurrence(boolean)

      • isConcurrent

        public boolean isConcurrent()
        Returns true if the task is concurrent, i.e., if it runs in parallel, and false otherwise.

        Task concurrence should be implemented by derived classes.

        See Also:
        enableConcurrence(boolean), isRecurrent()
